content: avril mini shawl by lolita le provost avril ©lolita le provost 2023 not for reproduction resale or commercial manufacture this shawlette is knit from one side to the other in stockinette you begin with the contrast corner in c1 increasing one stitch every 4 row then switch to the the main part of the shawlette in c2 for the rest of the increases and all of the decreases next you crochet lines of c3 in the purl grooves you have created in the stockinette and finally you add the i-cord edge in c4 the sample uses 4 colors of merino sport from la bien aimée materials c1 1 mini 20g skein of merino sport in kokko for the corner c2 2 mini 20g skeins of merino sport in sansa for the main part c3 1 mini 20g skein of merino sport in peach sweater for the lines c4 1 mini 20g skein of merino sport in anemone for the i-cord notions 3 5mm knitting needles glossary co cast on k1fb knit one 3 5mm crochet hook darning needle through the front loop and one gauge 24 stitches x 30 row = 10cm through the back loop of the same after blocking in stockinette stitch k2tog knit two stitches together sl slip notes in the sample c3 is used to crochet 6 lines into purl grooves in the stockinette you can add purl grooves as often as you like and space them out however you like though this may affect the meterage required to add a purl groove p the 3rd st on the 3rd row of the 4-row repeat in all subsequent row work sts as they are presented k the k sts and p the p sts in the sample purl grooves are added on row 23 59 107 119 139 and 183 for i-cord and kitchener stitch techniques you can find helpful video tutorials on youtube pattern co 3 st in c1 using your preferred method r1 rs sl1 knitwise k1fb k1 1st increased r2 ws sl1 purlwise p to end of row r3 rs sl1 knitwise k to end of row
